title.narrative: MAURITANIA - Basic Education Sector Support Project - Phase 2

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to improve the quality of primary education and service delivery in Selected Regions.

condition.narrative: Not later than four (4) months after the Effective Date or any later date agreed upon in writing with the Association, theRecipient, through MENFTR, shall recruit or assign to the Project: (i) an internal auditor; and (ii) an external auditor; both withterms of reference, qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association.

The Manuals of Procedures shall include: (i) a manual for the design and implementation of ENIs educational projects; (ii) a manualfor the operationalization of COGES, as well as the design and implementation of the school implementation plans and the managementof School Grants; (iii) a manual for the design and implementation of the RDPs; and (iv) a financial management manual to clarifyroles and responsibilities of all stakeholders, including School Grants beneficiaries, the latter which shall be adopted by theRecipient in form and substance satisfactory to the Association no later than four (4) months after the Effective Date, or anylater date agreed upon in writing with the Association.

The Recipient shall ensure at all times during Project implementation after January 1, 2023, or any other date agreed upon inwriting with the Association, that the CNE in charge of the administration and evaluation of primary school teachers underComponent 1 of the Project is staffed with sufficient and adequate personnel, and the necessary resources to carry out the relevantactivities to be implemented under the Project.

The Recipient shall establish, not later than two (2) months after the effective date, and thereafter maintain, throughout theProject implementation period with composition, mandate, and resources satisfactory to the Association, a Steering Committee, to bechaired by representative of the Minister of MENFTR, the DSPC shall serve as its secretary, and it shall further be comprised of,inter alia, representatives of the Recipient’s Ministry of Economic Affairs and the Promotion of Productive Sectors; Ministry ofCivil Service; as well as, a representative of the ENIs. The Steering Committee shall also include, as observers, representativesof IDENs and DRENs; civil society; and teachers’ unions.

The Recipient shall no later than two (2) months after the Effective Date recruit and maintain throughout Project implementation: aProject coordinator; a component-specific technical coordinator for each Components 1 and 2 of the Project; a financial managementspecialist; a procurement specialist; a monitoring and evaluation specialist; a construction manager; an environmental safeguardsspecialist; a social safeguards specialist; a communications and citizen engagement specialist; an accountant; and assistants asneeded; all with qualifications, terms of reference and experience acceptable to the Association.
